title: Fiona Phillips reveals why she felt ‘uncomfortable’ on Loose Women
text:
Fiona Phillips has been a familiar TV face for three decades (Picture: Rex Features)

Fiona Phillips has opened up about her ‘uncomfortable’ time on ITV show Loose Women.

What’s more, the star says it was all down to not wanting to talk about her family.

We wonder what Nadia Sawalha makes of that!

Speaking to The Express online, Fiona said: ‘I never really felt as though it was the right fit for me. I’d feel uncomfortable talking about my family.

I’ve always been quite private about my family, I’ve never used them in my career or anything.’

Fiona is keen to protect her privacy (Picture: Rex Features)

She also ruled out a return to the show, adding her life ‘would be a mess if I was still on there.’

‘If I said something about our private lives my husband wouldn’t speak to me again,’ she added.

‘I’ve been brought up around boys, I’ve got sons and brothers, and I’ve never had a sister. I’ve got brilliant friends who are women but I’m not one of those women who sits around gossiping.’

Metro.co.uk has reached out to Fiona’s reps for comment.

Eamonn Holmes, Ross Kelly, Fiona Phillips, Mr Motivator Derrick Evans and Lorraine Kelly on GMTV (Picture: ITV)

Fiona of course shot to fame as a face of GMTV in the 90s.

The veteran TV presenter was a regular panelist on Loose Women in 2002. She returned as a guest anchor in 2004, 2005, 2009 and 2010.
